info.title: SearchServiceClient
info.description: Client that can be used to manage and query indexes and documents, as well as manage other resources, on a search service.

put.description: Creates a new datasource or updates a datasource if it already exists.

parameters.name: dataSourceName
parameters.description: The name of the datasource to create or update.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: The definition of the datasource to create or update.

parameters.name: dataSourceName
parameters.description: The name of the datasource to delete.

parameters.name: dataSourceName
parameters.description: The name of the datasource to retrieve.

get.description: Lists all datasources available for a search service.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Selects which top-level properties of the data sources to retrieve. Specified as a comma-separated list of JSON property names, or `*` for all properties. The default is all properties.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: The definition of the datasource to create.

post.description: Resets the change tracking state associated with an indexer.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer to reset.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer to run.

put.description: Creates a new indexer or updates an indexer if it already exists.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer to create or update.

parameters.name: indexer
parameters.description: The definition of the indexer to create or update.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer to delete.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer to retrieve.

get.description: Lists all indexers available for a search service.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Selects which top-level properties of the indexers to retrieve. Specified as a comma-separated list of JSON property names, or `*` for all properties. The default is all properties.

parameters.name: indexer
parameters.description: The definition of the indexer to create.

get.description: Returns the current status and execution history of an indexer.

parameters.name: indexerName
parameters.description: The name of the indexer for which to retrieve status.

put.description: Creates a new skillset in a search service or updates the skillset if it already exists.

parameters.name: skillsetName
parameters.description: The name of the skillset to create or update.

parameters.name: skillset
parameters.description: The skillset containing one or more skills to create or update in a search service.

delete.description: Deletes a skillset in a search service.

parameters.name: skillsetName
parameters.description: The name of the skillset to delete.

404.description: The provided skillset name is not found.

get.description: Retrieves a skillset in a search service.

parameters.name: skillsetName
parameters.description: The name of the skillset to retrieve.

get.description: List all skillsets in a search service.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Selects which top-level properties of the skillsets to retrieve. Specified as a comma-separated list of JSON property names, or `*` for all properties. The default is all properties.

post.description: Creates a new skillset in a search service.

parameters.name: skillset
parameters.description: The skillset containing one or more skills to create in a search service.

put.description: Creates a new synonym map or updates a synonym map if it already exists.

parameters.name: synonymMapName
parameters.description: The name of the synonym map to create or update.

parameters.name: synonymMap
parameters.description: The definition of the synonym map to create or update.

parameters.name: synonymMapName
parameters.description: The name of the synonym map to delete.

parameters.name: synonymMapName
parameters.description: The name of the synonym map to retrieve.

get.description: Lists all synonym maps available for a search service.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Selects which top-level properties of the synonym maps to retrieve. Specified as a comma-separated list of JSON property names, or `*` for all properties. The default is all properties.

parameters.name: synonymMap
parameters.description: The definition of the synonym map to create.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The definition of the index to create.

get.description: Lists all indexes available for a search service.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Selects which top-level properties of the index definitions to retrieve. Specified as a comma-separated list of JSON property names, or `*` for all properties. The default is all properties.

put.description: Creates a new search index or updates an index if it already exists.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: The definition of the index to create or update.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The definition of the index to create or update.

parameters.name: allowIndexDowntime
parameters.description: Allows new analyzers, tokenizers, token filters, or char filters to be added to an index by taking the index offline for at least a few seconds. This temporarily causes indexing and query requests to fail. Performance and write availability of the index can be impaired for several minutes after the index is updated, or longer for very large indexes.

delete.description: Deletes a search index and all the documents it contains. This operation is permanent, with no recovery option. Make sure you have a master copy of your index definition, data ingestion code, and a backup of the primary data source in case you need to re-build the index.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: The name of the index to delete.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: The name of the index to retrieve.

get.description: Returns statistics for the given index, including a document count and storage usage.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: The name of the index for which to retrieve statistics.

post.description: Shows how an analyzer breaks text into tokens.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: The name of the index for which to test an analyzer.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The text and analyzer or analysis components to test.

get.description: Gets service level statistics for a search service.

text.description: The text to break into tokens.

analyzer.description: The name of the analyzer to use to break the given text. If this parameter is not specified, you must specify a tokenizer instead. The tokenizer and analyzer parameters are mutually exclusive.

tokenizer.description: The name of the tokenizer to use to break the given text. If this parameter is not specified, you must specify an analyzer instead. The tokenizer and analyzer parameters are mutually exclusive.

tokenFilters.description: An optional list of token filters to use when breaking the given text. This parameter can only be set when using the tokenizer parameter.

charFilters.description: An optional list of character filters to use when breaking the given text. This parameter can only be set when using the tokenizer parameter.

AnalyzeRequest.description: Specifies some text and analysis components used to break that text into tokens.

tokens.description: The list of tokens returned by the analyzer specified in the request.

AnalyzeResult.description: The result of testing an analyzer on text.

token.description: The token returned by the analyzer.

startOffset.description: The index of the first character of the token in the input text.

endOffset.description: The index of the last character of the token in the input text.

position.description: The position of the token in the input text relative to other tokens. The first token in the input text has position 0, the next has position 1, and so on. Depending on the analyzer used, some tokens might have the same position, for example if they are synonyms of each other.

AnalyzedTokenInfo.description: Information about a token returned by an analyzer.

values.name: StandardLucene
values.description: Standard Lucene analyzer.

values.name: StandardAsciiFoldingLucene
values.description: Standard ASCII Folding Lucene analyzer. See https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/searchservice/Custom-analyzers-in-Azure-Search#Analyzers

values.name: Keyword
values.description: Treats the entire content of a field as a single token. This is useful for data like zip codes, ids, and some product names. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/KeywordAnalyzer.html

values.name: Pattern
values.description: Flexibly separates text into terms via a regular expression pattern. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/PatternAnalyzer.html

values.name: Simple
values.description: Divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/SimpleAnalyzer.html

values.name: Stop
values.description: Divides text at non-letters; Applies the lowercase and stopword token filters. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/StopAnalyzer.html

values.name: Whitespace
values.description: An analyzer that uses the whitespace tokenizer. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/WhitespaceAnalyzer.html

LexicalAnalyzerName.description: Defines the names of all text analyzers supported by the search engine.

values.name: Classic
values.description: Grammar-based tokenizer that is suitable for processing most European-language documents. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/ClassicTokenizer.html

values.name: EdgeNGram
values.description: Tokenizes the input from an edge into n-grams of the given size(s). See https://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/EdgeNGramTokenizer.html

values.name: Keyword
values.description: Emits the entire input as a single token. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/KeywordTokenizer.html

values.name: Letter
values.description: Divides text at non-letters. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/LetterTokenizer.html

values.name: Lowercase
values.description: Divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/LowerCaseTokenizer.html

values.name: MicrosoftLanguageTokenizer
values.description: Divides text using language-specific rules.

values.name: MicrosoftLanguageStemmingTokenizer
values.description: Divides text using language-specific rules and reduces words to their base forms.

values.name: NGram
values.description: Tokenizes the input into n-grams of the given size(s). See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/NGramTokenizer.html

values.name: PathHierarchy
values.description: Tokenizer for path-like hierarchies. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/path/PathHierarchyTokenizer.html

values.name: Pattern
values.description: Tokenizer that uses regex pattern matching to construct distinct tokens. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/pattern/PatternTokenizer.html

values.name: Standard
values.description: Standard Lucene analyzer; Composed of the standard tokenizer, lowercase filter and stop filter. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/StandardTokenizer.html

values.name: UaxUrlEmail
values.description: Tokenizes urls and emails as one token. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/UAX29URLEmailTokenizer.html

values.name: Whitespace
values.description: Divides text at whitespace. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/WhitespaceTokenizer.html

LexicalTokenizerName.description: Defines the names of all tokenizers supported by the search engine.

values.name: ArabicNormalization
values.description: A token filter that applies the Arabic normalizer to normalize the orthography. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ar/ArabicNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: Apostrophe
values.description: Strips all characters after an apostrophe (including the apostrophe itself). See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/tr/ApostropheFilter.html

values.name: AsciiFolding
values.description: Converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the "Basic Latin" Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if such equivalents exist. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/ASCIIFoldingFilter.html

values.name: CjkBigram
values.description: Forms bigrams of CJK terms that are generated from the standard tokenizer. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/cjk/CJKBigramFilter.html

values.name: CjkWidth
values.description: Normalizes CJK width differences. Folds fullwidth ASCII variants into the equivalent basic Latin, and half-width Katakana variants into the equivalent Kana. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/cjk/CJKWidthFilter.html

values.name: Classic
values.description: Removes English possessives, and dots from acronyms. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/ClassicFilter.html

values.name: CommonGram
values.description: Construct bigrams for frequently occurring terms while indexing. Single terms are still indexed too, with bigrams overlaid. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/commongrams/CommonGramsFilter.html

values.name: EdgeNGram
values.description: Generates n-grams of the given size(s) starting from the front or the back of an input token. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/EdgeNGramTokenFilter.html

values.name: Elision
values.description: Removes elisions. For example, "l'avion" (the plane) will be converted to "avion" (plane). See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/util/ElisionFilter.html

values.name: GermanNormalization
values.description: Normalizes German characters according to the heuristics of the German2 snowball algorithm. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/de/GermanNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: HindiNormalization
values.description: Normalizes text in Hindi to remove some differences in spelling variations. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/hi/HindiNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: IndicNormalization
values.description: Normalizes the Unicode representation of text in Indian languages. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/in/IndicNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: KeywordRepeat
values.description: Emits each incoming token twice, once as keyword and once as non-keyword. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/KeywordRepeatFilter.html

values.name: KStem
values.description: A high-performance kstem filter for English. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/en/KStemFilter.html

values.name: Length
values.description: Removes words that are too long or too short. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/LengthFilter.html

values.name: Limit
values.description: Limits the number of tokens while indexing. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/LimitTokenCountFilter.html

values.name: Lowercase
values.description: Normalizes token text to lower case. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/LowerCaseFilter.htm

values.name: NGram
values.description: Generates n-grams of the given size(s). See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/NGramTokenFilter.html

values.name: PersianNormalization
values.description: Applies normalization for Persian. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/fa/PersianNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: Phonetic
values.description: Create tokens for phonetic matches. See https://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-phonetic/org/apache/lucene/analysis/phonetic/package-tree.html

values.name: PorterStem
values.description: Uses the Porter stemming algorithm to transform the token stream. See http://tartarus.org/~martin/PorterStemmer

values.name: Reverse
values.description: Reverses the token string. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/reverse/ReverseStringFilter.html

values.name: ScandinavianNormalization
values.description: Normalizes use of the interchangeable Scandinavian characters. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/ScandinavianNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: ScandinavianFoldingNormalization
values.description: Folds Scandinavian characters ->a and ->o. It also discriminates against use of double vowels aa, ae, ao, oe and oo, leaving just the first one. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/ScandinavianFoldingFilter.html

values.name: Shingle
values.description: Creates combinations of tokens as a single token. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/shingle/ShingleFilter.html

values.name: Snowball
values.description: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/snowball/SnowballFilter.html

values.name: SoraniNormalization
values.description: Normalizes the Unicode representation of Sorani text. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ckb/SoraniNormalizationFilter.html

values.name: Stemmer
values.description: Language specific stemming filter. See https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/searchservice/Custom-analyzers-in-Azure-Search#TokenFilters

values.name: Stopwords
values.description: Removes stop words from a token stream. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/StopFilter.html

values.name: Trim
values.description: Trims leading and trailing whitespace from tokens. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/TrimFilter.html

values.name: Truncate
values.description: Truncates the terms to a specific length. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/TruncateTokenFilter.html

values.name: Unique
values.description: Filters out tokens with same text as the previous token. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/miscellaneous/RemoveDuplicatesTokenFilter.html

values.name: Uppercase
values.description: Normalizes token text to upper case. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/core/UpperCaseFilter.html

values.name: WordDelimiter
values.description: Splits words into subwords and performs optional transformations on subword groups.

TokenFilterName.description: Defines the names of all token filters supported by the search engine.

values.name: HtmlStrip
values.description: A character filter that attempts to strip out HTML constructs. See https://lucene.apache.org/core/4_10_3/analyzers-common/org/apache/lucene/analysis/charfilter/HTMLStripCharFilter.html

CharFilterName.description: Defines the names of all character filters supported by the search engine.

values.name: CanonEq
values.description: Enables canonical equivalence.

values.name: CaseInsensitive
values.description: Enables case-insensitive matching.

values.name: Comments
values.description: Permits whitespace and comments in the pattern.

values.name: DotAll
values.description: Enables dotall mode.

values.name: Literal
values.description: Enables literal parsing of the pattern.

values.name: Multiline
values.description: Enables multiline mode.

values.name: UnicodeCase
values.description: Enables Unicode-aware case folding.

values.name: UnixLines
values.description: Enables Unix lines mode.

RegexFlags.description: Defines flags that can be combined to control how regular expressions are used in the pattern analyzer and pattern tokenizer.

values.name: String
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a string.

values.name: Int32
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a 32-bit signed integer.

values.name: Int64
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a 64-bit signed integer.

values.name: Double
values.description: Indicates that a field contains an IEEE double-precision floating point number.

values.name: Boolean
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a Boolean value (true or false).

values.name: DateTimeOffset
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a date/time value, including timezone information.

values.name: GeographyPoint
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a geo-location in terms of longitude and latitude.

values.name: Complex
values.description: Indicates that a field contains one or more complex objects that in turn have sub-fields of other types.

values.name: Single
values.description: Indicates that a field contains a single-precision floating point number. This is only valid when used with Collection(Edm.Single).

SearchFieldDataType.description: Defines the data type of a field in a search index.

@odata.type.description: A URI fragment specifying the type of analyzer.

name.description: The name of the analyzer. It must only contain letters, digits, spaces, dashes or underscores, can only start and end with alphanumeric characters, and is limited to 128 characters.

tokenizer.description: The name of the tokenizer to use to divide continuous text into a sequence of tokens, such as breaking a sentence into words.

tokenFilters.description: A list of token filters used to filter out or modify the tokens generated by a tokenizer. For example, you can specify a lowercase filter that converts all characters to lowercase. The filters are run in the order in which they are listed.

charFilters.description: A list of character filters used to prepare input text before it is processed by the tokenizer. For instance, they can replace certain characters or symbols. The filters are run in the order in which they are listed.

CustomAnalyzer.description: Allows you to take control over the process of converting text into indexable/searchable tokens. It's a user-defined configuration consisting of a single predefined tokenizer and one or more filters. The tokenizer is responsible for breaking text into tokens, and the filters for modifying tokens emitted by the tokenizer.

lowercase.description: A value indicating whether terms should be lower-cased. Default is true.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern to match token separators. Default is an expression that matches one or more non-word characters.

PatternAnalyzer.description: Flexibly separates text into terms via a regular expression pattern. This analyzer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default is 255. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. The maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters.

LuceneStandardAnalyzer.description: Standard Apache Lucene analyzer; Composed of the standard tokenizer, lowercase filter and stop filter.

StopAnalyzer.description: Divides text at non-letters; Applies the lowercase and stopword token filters. This analyzer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

@odata.type.description: A URI fragment specifying the type of tokenizer.

name.description: The name of the tokenizer. It must only contain letters, digits, spaces, dashes or underscores, can only start and end with alphanumeric characters, and is limited to 128 characters.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default is 255. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. The maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters.

ClassicTokenizer.description: Grammar-based tokenizer that is suitable for processing most European-language documents. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

values.name: Letter
values.description: Keeps letters in tokens.

values.name: Digit
values.description: Keeps digits in tokens.

values.name: Whitespace
values.description: Keeps whitespace in tokens.

values.name: Punctuation
values.description: Keeps punctuation in tokens.

values.name: Symbol
values.description: Keeps symbols in tokens.

TokenCharacterKind.description: Represents classes of characters on which a token filter can operate.

minGram.description: The minimum n-gram length. Default is 1. Maximum is 300. Must be less than the value of maxGram.

maxGram.description: The maximum n-gram length. Default is 2. Maximum is 300.

tokenChars.description: Character classes to keep in the tokens.

EdgeNGramTokenizer.description: Tokenizes the input from an edge into n-grams of the given size(s). This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

bufferSize.description: The read buffer size in bytes. Default is 256.

KeywordTokenizer.description: Emits the entire input as a single token. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default is 256. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. The maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters.

KeywordTokenizerV2.description: Emits the entire input as a single token. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

MicrosoftTokenizerLanguage.description: Lists the languages supported by the Microsoft language tokenizer.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. Maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters. Tokens longer than 300 characters are first split into tokens of length 300 and then each of those tokens is split based on the max token length set. Default is 255.

isSearchTokenizer.description: A value indicating how the tokenizer is used. Set to true if used as the search tokenizer, set to false if used as the indexing tokenizer. Default is false.

language.description: The language to use. The default is English.

MicrosoftStemmingTokenizerLanguage.description: Lists the languages supported by the Microsoft language stemming tokenizer.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. Maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters. Tokens longer than 300 characters are first split into tokens of length 300 and then each of those tokens is split based on the max token length set. Default is 255.

isSearchTokenizer.description: A value indicating how the tokenizer is used. Set to true if used as the search tokenizer, set to false if used as the indexing tokenizer. Default is false.

language.description: The language to use. The default is English.

MicrosoftLanguageStemmingTokenizer.description: Divides text using language-specific rules and reduces words to their base forms.

minGram.description: The minimum n-gram length. Default is 1. Maximum is 300. Must be less than the value of maxGram.

maxGram.description: The maximum n-gram length. Default is 2. Maximum is 300.

tokenChars.description: Character classes to keep in the tokens.

NGramTokenizer.description: Tokenizes the input into n-grams of the given size(s). This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

delimiter.description: The delimiter character to use. Default is "/".

replacement.description: A value that, if set, replaces the delimiter character. Default is "/".

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default and maximum is 300.

reverse.description: A value indicating whether to generate tokens in reverse order. Default is false.

skip.description: The number of initial tokens to skip. Default is 0.

PathHierarchyTokenizerV2.description: Tokenizer for path-like hierarchies. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern to match token separators. Default is an expression that matches one or more non-word characters.

group.description: The zero-based ordinal of the matching group in the regular expression pattern to extract into tokens. Use -1 if you want to use the entire pattern to split the input into tokens, irrespective of matching groups. Default is -1.

PatternTokenizer.description: Tokenizer that uses regex pattern matching to construct distinct tokens. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default is 255. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split.

LuceneStandardTokenizer.description: Breaks text following the Unicode Text Segmentation rules. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.

maxTokenLength.description: The maximum token length. Default is 255. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. The maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters.

LuceneStandardTokenizerV2.description: Breaks text following the Unicode Text Segmentation rules. This tokenizer is implemented using Apache Lucene.
